2.speaker: sasako
2.japanese: 珍しいですね あくびなんて

3.speaker: polar bear
3.japanese: 最近 ちょっと不眠症気味で
3.english: I've been suffering from insomnia lately.

4.speaker: panda
4.japanese: つらいよね 僕も同じだよ
4.english: It's rough. I've been going through it, too. You say that, but didn't you fall asleep while eating at the counter the other day?

5.speaker: panda
5.japanese: やだな あれは まばたきだよ
5.english: Oh, please. I was just blinking.

6.speaker: penguin
6.japanese: いや ずっと閉じてたから
6.english: No, your eyes were completely shut.

7.speaker: panda
7.japanese: 閉じることは閉じるけど一瞬だよ
7.english: They were shut, but only for a moment.

8.speaker: panda
8.japanese: 夜だってさ 目を閉じたら一瞬で朝になってるんだもん
8.english: Even when I close them for a second at night, it becomes morning instantly.

9.speaker: polar bear
9.english: You're sleeping very well. Are you having that much trouble sleeping, Polar Bear?

10.speaker: polar bear
10.japanese: 眠る方法はいろいろ試してみたんだけどね
10.english: I tried various ways to fall asleep...

11.speaker: sasako
11.japanese: お風呂は 毎日入ってますか
11.english: Are you taking baths every day?

12.speaker: sasako
12.japanese: リラックスできますよ

13.speaker: polar bear
13.japanese: 入ってるよ ひんやり氷風呂
13.english: I do. I take very cold ice baths.

15.speaker: panda
15.japanese: かわいいものを数えればいいよ

17.speaker: panda
17.japanese: かわいい僕を数えれば ほっこりして眠くなってくるよ
17.english: If you count something as cute as me, you'll feel all warm and fuzzy and get sleepy.

18.speaker: panda
18.english: One panda. Two pandas. Three pandas...

19.speaker: polar bear
19.japanese: パンダ君 さすがだね

20.speaker: penguin
20.japanese: 起きようか パンダ君

21.speaker: polar bear
21.japanese: 今夜 試してみるよ
21.english: I'll give it a try tonight.

23.speaker: panda
23.english: Are you sure you counted me correctly?

24.speaker: polar bear
24.japanese: 数えたけど ダメだったよ
24.english: I did, but it didn't help.

26.speaker: polar bear
26.japanese: 別のものも数えてみた
26.english: I tried counting other things, too.

30.speaker: penguin
30.english: That'd be a little hard to count.

34.speaker: penguin
34.japanese: なんで舟盛り いや おいしそうだけどさ
34.english: Why is there a sushi boat? I mean, it looks good and all, but...

35.speaker: polar bear
35.japanese: こまかい作業って疲れるから 眠れるかと思って
35.english: Working on intricate things makes you tired, so I thought it'd help me sleep.

36.speaker: penguin
36.english: But that'd make you more alert, wouldn't it?

37.speaker: polar bear
37.english: Yeah, I ended up wide awake instead.

38.speaker: sasako
38.japanese: 眠るといえばあの人ですよね
38.english: There's someone we associate with sleep.

40.speaker: grizzly
40.japanese: 眠る方法 知らねえよ こっちは冬眠してんだよ
40.english: A way to fall asleep? How the hell should I know?! I'm hibernating over here!

42.speaker: penguin
42.japanese: そりゃ 怒るでしょ

43.speaker: panda
43.japanese: ひどいな シロクマ君

45.speaker: panda
45.japanese: グリズリーさん ごめんね ちゃんと寝れてる
45.english: Mr. Grizzly? Sorry. Have you been sleeping well? Here!

46.speaker: grizzly
46.japanese: お前らからもらった低反発まくら
46.english: The memory foam pillow you guys got me works well,

47.japanese: よかったから 買ってきたぞ

49.speaker: grizzly
49.japanese: まだまだ すんなりと眠りに入るためには 香りも大事だ
49.english: That's not all. To be able to fall asleep immediately, scent is important.

51.speaker: grizzly
51.japanese: 更に 心が落ち着くゆらぎの炎
51.english: And then there's the flickering flame to calm your heart...

52.speaker: grizzly
52.english: An aroma candle. And finally, a lullaby to play by your pillow.

54.speaker: penguin
54.english: What kind of ritual is this?!

55.speaker: panda
55.japanese: グリズリーさん こういうのどこで買うの
55.english: Where do you get this stuff, Mr. Grizzly?

56.speaker: panda
56.japanese: 案外 乙女チックだね

57.speaker: grizzly
57.japanese: うるせぇ やれ シロクマ
57.english: C-Can it! Use all that, Polar Bear! You'll be able to sleep!

60.speaker: grizzly
60.japanese: オルゴール ちゃんときいたか
60.english: Did you listen to the music box? Yeah.

61.speaker: grizzly
61.japanese: チクショウ ダメだったか

63.speaker: sasako
63.japanese: ムリに眠ろうとするのも よくないっていいますよね
63.english: They say it's not a good idea to force yourself to sleep, either.

65.speaker: sasako
65.japanese: 眠れなきゃ眠れないでいいくらいの気持でいるといいって
65.english: They say that if you can't sleep, then you should just let it be.

68.speaker: panda
68.japanese: 働きたくなきゃ働かないでいいと思うと
68.english: Thinking that I don't have to work if I don't feel like it

70.speaker: penguin
70.japanese: キミは もっと頑張って働こうよ
70.english: I think you should try working a little harder, actually.

71.speaker: sasako
71.japanese: 静かすぎるより 適度な雑音があったほうが
71.english: They say it can be easier to sleep with a bit of white noise

72.speaker: sasako
72.japanese: よく眠れるっていいますよ
72.english: rather than having it completely quiet.

73.speaker: panda
73.japanese: だから僕バイトしてるとき寝ちゃうんだ
73.english: So that's why I fall asleep when I'm at work.

74.speaker: penguin
74.japanese: バイトにかぎらずだけどね

75.speaker: panda
75.japanese: お客さんのざわざわ話す声が
75.english: The sounds from the visitors talking is really soothing.

76.speaker: panda
76.japanese: シロクマ君 動物園で寝なよ
76.english: Polar Bear! You should sleep at the zoo!

77.speaker: grizzly
77.english: There aren't any visitors at night.

78.speaker: panda
78.japanese: お昼に来て寝たらいいよ
78.english: So he should come during the day and sleep.

81.speaker: penguin
81.japanese: 眠気を誘うといえば この２人だと思って
81.english: When I thought of something that makes you sleepy,

82.speaker: penguin
82.japanese: 声をかけておいたんだ おととい
82.english: I thought of these two, so I called them over... Two days ago.

84.speaker: penguin
84.japanese: いいね いいね 眠気を誘うよ さすがだね
84.english: That's it. You're doing great. Getting sleepy already.

86.speaker: penguin
86.japanese: って 早いよ パンダ君

87.speaker: panda
87.japanese: あれ またまばたきしてた

88.speaker: sasako
88.japanese: 成功じゃないですか もっと話してみてください
88.english: I think it's working. Please try talking more.

93.speaker: penguin
93.japanese: お 恐ろしい威力だね
93.english: I-It's scary how well that works.

94.japanese: シロクマ君も さすがに…
94.english: I'm sure that even Polar Be—

98.speaker: polar bear
98.japanese: 注文とかとるときお客様の声をちゃんと聞かないとって思うからかな
98.english: Because when I take orders, I feel like I need to listen to the customers very carefully.

99.speaker: penguin
99.english: You're a shining example of a café owner.

100.speaker: penguin
100.japanese: 僕が思うに シロクマ君はマスターとしての責任を
100.english: The way I see it, I think you're trying too hard to fulfill

101.japanese: 果たそうとしすぎてるんじゃないかな
101.english: your job as the owner of the café.

102.speaker: penguin
102.japanese: だから眠ることができないんだよ
102.english: That's probably why you can't sleep.

103.speaker: penguin
103.japanese: でも人生ってそういうものじゃないんだ
103.english: But that's not what life's all about.

104.speaker: penguin
104.japanese: 緩めるところと引き締めるところ
104.english: There are things you have to worry about and things you don't. As long as the pluses and minuses balance out to zero.

105.speaker: penguin
105.japanese: って 寝ないでよ 今 いいこと言ったのに
105.english: Hey! Don't fall asleep now! I just said something important!

107.speaker: panda
107.japanese: なんで起こしちゃうの

109.speaker: panda
109.japanese: すごいね ペンギンさんの催眠術
109.english: Your hypnosis is amazing, Mr. Penguin.

111.speaker: polar bear
111.japanese: ペンギンさん ひとつお願いしていいかな
111.english: Mr. Penguin, could I ask you a favor?

112.speaker: penguin
112.japanese: ペンギンの人生をマネジメントする１００の方法
112.english: Penguin's 100 ways to manage your life.

113.speaker: penguin
113.japanese: その１ 自分を褒めるのは自分と心得よ
113.english: Number 1: Understand that you have to compliment yourself.

114.speaker: penguin
114.japanese: その２ 自分を咎めるのは最後にせよ
114.english: Number 2: Be the last to put the blame on yourself.

115.speaker: penguin
115.japanese: その３ 今日やれないことは明日もできない…
115.english: Number 3: What you can't be done today, also can't be done tomorrow.

116.speaker: polar bear
116.japanese: ペンギンさん すごくよかったよ
116.english: That was great, Mr. Penguin. Great to hear, Mr. Polar Bear.

118.speaker: penguin
118.japanese: ねぇねぇ 何が一番心に残った
118.english: So, what stuck in your mind the most.

120.speaker: polar bear
120.japanese: ペンギンの人生を何とかってところ
120.english: Something about Penguin's Life or other.

121.speaker: penguin
121.japanese: あれ それって 一番最初じゃない
121.english: Huh? Isn't that the very beginning?

125.speaker: grizzly
125.japanese: おい 倉庫にスコップなんてねえぞ
125.english: Hey! There wasn't a shovel in the shed!

126.speaker: polar bear
126.japanese: 横に立てかけてあるでしょ
126.english: It should have been resting against the side. What?! It's not inside the shed?

127.speaker: panda
127.japanese: グリズリーさん 冬眠しないの
127.english: Aren't you going to hibernate, Mr. Grizzly?

128.speaker: grizzly
128.japanese: 何べんも何べんも起こしやがってるのはどこのどいつらだよ
128.english: Who the hell are the ones that keep waking me up over and over?!

129.speaker: grizzly
129.japanese: おかげで目が冴えちまったじゃねえか
129.english: Because of you guys, I'm wide awake.

130.speaker: grizzly
130.japanese: こうなるとまた寝つくのに苦労するんだよ
130.english: Now it's going to take me forever to settle down to sleep.

131.speaker: grizzly
131.japanese: 体を動かすぜ 雪おろしさせろ
131.english: I'm going to move around a bit! Let me snow shovel!

132.speaker: grizzly
132.english: The shovel's by the shed, right?

134.speaker: sasako
134.japanese: お二人性格は全然違う感じなのに 仲よしですよね
134.english: You two seem to have completely different personalities, but you get along so well.

136.speaker: polar bear
136.japanese: まあ グリズリー君と僕
136.english: Well, Grizzly and I are childhood friends.

137.speaker: sasako
137.english: Are you two the same age?

138.speaker: polar bear
138.japanese: うん ずっと同級だよ
138.english: Yup. We were in the same grade.

140.speaker: polar bear
140.japanese: こんな日は いろいろ思い出すね
140.english: Days like this remind me of a lot of things.

141.speaker: polar bear
141.japanese: やっぱり ここにいた
141.english: I knew you'd be here. Oh, it's you, Polar Bear.

142.speaker: polar bear
142.japanese: 先生が探してたよ 呼び出されてるんでしょ
142.english: The teacher was looking for you. You've been summoned, haven't you?

143.speaker: grizzly
143.japanese: 冬眠できねえから眠いんだよ
143.english: I can't hibernate, so I'm tired.

146.speaker: grizzly
146.japanese: 勝手に目の敵にしやがって
146.english: They're just out to get me.

147.speaker: polar bear
147.japanese: グリズリー君 目立つからね
147.english: Well, you do stand out, Grizzly.

148.speaker: grizzly
148.english: Must be nice to be you.

149.speaker: grizzly
149.japanese: みんなに好かれてるわ 優等生だわ
149.english: Liked by everyone, and an honor student.

151.speaker: grizzly
151.english: I do. Whatever. I guess I'll go.

152.speaker: polar bear
152.japanese: うん それがいいよ

153.speaker: grizzly
153.japanese: 帰り 一緒に帰ろうぜ

155.speaker: grizzly
155.english: We'll meet up at the school gates. Okay.

156.speaker: grizzly
156.japanese: でよ 態度がでかいとか言うからさ
156.english: So they were like... "You act all big." So I told them,

157.speaker: grizzly
157.japanese: 体と声がでかいのは遺伝です ってな
157.english: "My voice and body are both big because of genetics!"

158.speaker: polar bear
158.english: How much do you weigh now?

159.speaker: grizzly
159.english: Two hundred kilograms. What about you? Two twenty.

160.speaker: grizzly
160.japanese: なんだよ お前のほうがでけぇじゃねえか
160.english: What the hell?! You're bigger than me!

161.speaker: grizzly
161.japanese: ったく なんで 俺だけ…
161.english: Damn it. Why are they just out to get me...

162.speaker: grizzly
162.english: Hey, Polar Bear. So, well, um, uh...

163.speaker: polar bear
163.japanese: わかってるよ 今日もあそこに行くんだよね
163.english: I know. You're going there again today, right? Y-Yeah...

165.speaker: polar bear
165.english: {\a6}Really? Aw man... school twice a week is totally enough. {\a6}Hell yeah! I'm so calm I'm about to fire it up! Oh, here we go.

167.speaker: grizzly
167.english: You jerk! Oh, here we go, for real.

168.speaker: grizzly
168.japanese: お前 わざとらしいんだよ

169.speaker: polar bear
169.japanese: あっ 月子さん来た

172.speaker: polar bear
172.japanese: わかった そっとね
172.english: All right, I'll talk more softly.

174.speaker: grizzly
174.japanese: どうなんだよ 月子さんの様子は
174.english: How does Miss Tsukiko seem to be to you?

176.speaker: grizzly
176.japanese: 普通 んなわけねえだろ

177.speaker: grizzly
177.japanese: メチャクチャ可憐で おしとやかだぜ

182.speaker: polar bear
182.japanese: 声くらいかければいいのに
182.english: You should at least talk to her.

184.speaker: polar bear
184.japanese: 帰り 本屋寄っていこうよ
184.english: Let's stop by the book store on our way home. S-Sure.

185.speaker: grizzly
185.japanese: クソッ 担任の野郎

186.speaker: grizzly
186.japanese: 毎度 毎度 話が長ぇんだよ
186.english: He always talks too damn much!

188.speaker: grizzly
188.japanese: バスが間に合わなかったらぶっ飛ばしてやる
188.english: If we miss the bus, I'm gonna beat his ass!

189.speaker: polar bear
189.japanese: もう２０分もすぎてるし 無理じゃない
189.english: We're already twenty minutes late. We're not going to make it.

192.speaker: grizzly
192.japanese: 何か探してるみたいなんだよ
192.english: It looks like she's looking for something. This is your chance. Huh?

193.speaker: polar bear
193.japanese: 何かお困りですかって聞いて ついでに手伝う
193.english: You can ask her if everything is okay and then help her out. Oh! I get it!

194.speaker: grizzly
194.japanese: じゃ シロクマ 頼む
194.english: All right, it's up to you, Polar Bear. Huh?

195.speaker: polar bear
195.japanese: グリズリー君が行きなよ チャンスなんだから
195.english: You should go, Grizzly. This is your chance.

196.speaker: grizzly
196.japanese: 俺が行ったら ダメだ
196.english: It won't work if I go. What? Why?

198.speaker: grizzly
198.japanese: 俺は こんなだし みんなに怖がられてるし
198.english: You know how I am. On top of that, everyone is scared of me.

199.speaker: grizzly
199.japanese: 月子さんを驚かせたくないんだよ
199.english: I don't want to scare Miss Tsukiko.

200.speaker: grizzly
200.japanese: だから 優等生で人畜無害なお前が行ってくれ
200.english: You're an honor student and no one's afraid of you, so you should go! I'll owe you for life, Polar Bear.

201.speaker: polar bear
201.english: Hello. Is everything okay? Huh? Well... Man, she really is cute... she's always been cute.

202.speaker: grizzly
202.japanese: シロクマ 月子さん 何だって
202.english: Polar Bear! What did Miss Tsukiko say? She said she lost her school badge. School badge?

207.speaker: polar bear
207.english: Let's take a little walk. S-Sure...

208.speaker: grizzly
208.japanese: 何だって 冗談だろ

209.speaker: grizzly
209.japanese: 冗談だよな いつものお前の…

210.speaker: polar bear
210.japanese: 家族で引っ越すんだって

211.speaker: polar bear
211.japanese: だから 一生懸命探してたんだって
211.english: So that's why she was trying really hard to find it.

214.speaker: polar bear
214.japanese: いい子だったよ 礼儀正しくて
214.english: She was really nice, and well-mannered. Yeah...

215.speaker: polar bear
215.japanese: 声も かわいかった
215.english: Her voice was really cute, too. Yeah...

216.speaker: mommy
216.japanese: お友達には ちゃんとお別れした
216.english: Did you say goodbye to all of your friends? I did... Mom?

218.speaker: tsukiko
218.english: I'm going to try to find it one last time. You can head on home.

219.speaker: mommy
219.japanese: お母さんも一緒に探そうか
219.english: Do you want me to look with you?

221.speaker: mommy
221.japanese: じゃあ風邪をひかないうちに帰るのよ
221.english: Then make sure you get home before you catch a cold.

224.speaker: grizzly
224.japanese: 月子さんが探しているのは これですか
224.english: Is this what you were looking for, Miss Tsukiko?

225.speaker: tsukiko
225.japanese: ありがとうございます

226.speaker: tsukiko
226.english: Pardon me. By chance, are you Mr. Polar Bear whom I met the other day?

227.speaker: grizzly
227.japanese: 雪が激しくなってきました
227.english: The snow's really starting to come down.

228.speaker: grizzly
228.japanese: 僕は平気ですが 月子さんは帰ったほうがいい
228.english: I'll be fine, but you should head home, Miss Tsukiko.

232.speaker: tsukiko
232.japanese: 本当にありがとうございました シロクマさん
232.english: Thank you very much, Mr. Polar Bear.

234.speaker: polar bear
234.japanese: いくらグリズリー君でも

235.japanese: ずっと雪の中にいちゃ 風邪ひいちゃうよ
235.english: if you stay out in the snow too long, Grizzly.

236.speaker: grizzly
236.japanese: 俺は グリズリーだぜ
236.english: I'm Grizzly. Like hell I'd catch a cold.

238.speaker: grizzly
238.japanese: あったかいもんを飲むのもよさそうだな
238.english: Having something warm to drink doesn't sound like a bad idea. Sure.

239.speaker: polar bear
239.japanese: じゃあ ココアにしよう
239.english: Then let's have some cocoa, with some marshmallows. Yeah.

240.speaker: penguin
240.japanese: それから どうしたの

242.speaker: sasako
242.japanese: 初恋だったんですね グリズリーさんの
242.english: So that must have been Mr. Grizzly's first love. Snow shoveling's done!

243.speaker: grizzly
243.japanese: クソーッ また降ってきやがったぜ

244.speaker: polar bear
244.japanese: 何か あったかいものでも飲む
244.english: Do you want something warm to drink?

245.speaker: grizzly
245.japanese: いいな ココアにしてくれ
245.english: Sounds good. Get me some cocoa.

247.speaker: sasako
247.japanese: お二人 仲よしなんですね
247.english: You two get along so well.

250.speaker: grizzly
250.japanese: 何だ 気持の悪いヤツらだな
250.english: What? You guys are acting weird.

251.speaker: panda
251.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

253.speaker: panda
253.japanese: 人柱になるとしたら どの柱がいい
253.english: If you were going to be a live sacrifice, how would you like it to be done?

254.speaker: penguin
254.japanese: 答えたくない質問って 世界にまだまだたくさんあるんだね
254.english: Apparently there are a lot of questions left in this world that I don't want to answer.

257.speaker: penguin
257.japanese: 笹子さん いい加減覚えていこう
257.english: Let's get it straight already, Miss Sasako.

259.speaker: penguin
259.japanese: しろくま君 終って

260.speaker: polar bear
260.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェイは

261.speaker: polar bear
261.japanese: 大切なあなたにお送りします
261.english: will be dedicated especially to you. Why are you suddenly talking like some popular Korean actor?
